channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report E-2024030181
item.description:
Report E-2024030181

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-13T18:16:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: WHITEHALL
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: JAMES A TURNER INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A CAR RAN INTO THE LOADING LINES LOCATED ON THE TRAILER AS OUR TRUCK WAS DRIVING SOUTHBOUND TO GET ONTO ROUTE 22 AND ABOUT 25 TO 50 GALLONS THAT WAS LEFT IN THE LOADING LINES WAS SPILLED AS A RESULT.

item.title: Report X-2024030390
item.description:
Report X-2024030390

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: READING
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was loaded onto the van on its side with orientation arrows facing the wrong direction. This was caused by improper loading onto the van. Item leaked some of contents. In house cleanup. DescribePack: There is no damage to the items itself other than leakage from improper orientation. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Item reoriented after discovery. Item ceased to leak afterwards.

item.title: Report X-2024030371
item.description:
Report X-2024030371

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: NEWVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: qa was called to leaking hazmat in the unload, upon discovery we found that the substance was a corrosive and leaking from the lid, looks as though the seal on the lid is faulty, Hazmat process was then started, hazmat was placed into a hazmat tote lined with a hazardous bag. Then all reports were submitted and hazmat was placed in Hazardous material cage. DescribePack: cap on the top of the bottle is loose and causing product to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: spill was cleaned up and hazmat was placed in a lined tote and stored in the hazardous materials storage area.

item.title: Report X-2024030104
item.description:
Report X-2024030104

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-01
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: WEARING PROPER PPE, RESPONDER USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUID. BOX WAS ON THE ROLLER LINE. BOX WAS WET ON BOTTOM CORNER NO LIQUID ON THE ROLLER LINE OR ON FLOOR. NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024030175
item.description:
Report E-2024030175

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-13T18:16:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Veolia material handler was transferring containers between trailers when he noticed a damp spot under the container. The container was inspected and a pin hole leak in the seam was identified. The drum was immediately overpacked for continued safe transportation to the destination facility.

item.title: Report I-2024030020
item.description:
Report I-2024030020

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: Pottstown
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: RSI LEASING INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FOLLOWING THE RAIL-TO-TRUCK TRANSLOADING OF BUTYL ACRYLATE, THE OPERATOR WAS MOVING THE PRODUCT HOSE AWAY FROM THE TOP OF THE TRAILER ON THE SWING ARM THAT SUPPORTS THE HOSE. AT SOME POINT THE CAP ON THE HOSE CAME LOOSE AND FELL OFF THE HOSE ALLOWING A SPILL OF RESIDUAL PRODUCT FROM THE HOSE.

item.title: Report X-2024030155
item.description:
Report X-2024030155

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment was taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package found on trailer number 807734 already wet and leaking upon inspection of inner content 2. x 2.5 plastic bottles of chem - aqua 1 x 2.5 gallon plastic bottle of chem-aqua had a loose cap allowing .25 gallon to release from bottle. package had no slotted partition, bags, or adsorbent. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 x 2.5-gallon plastic bottle of chem-aqua had a loose cap allowing .25 gallon to release from bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report X-2024030157
item.description:
Report X-2024030157

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: HUNKER
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver had the package inside the truck when a larger box from an upper shelf fell onto the hazmat package. Driver Left package up front at VSA, at which time QA responded and placed package inside red tote for transfer back to the cage. DescribePack: Box was wet on the outside. After inspection to figure out what fail, it came to the conclusion of a bad screw thread for one of the blue screw top bottles. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed on the side to prevent further leaking, than placed into a red tote and resealed the bottles on inspection

item.title: Report X-2024030029
item.description:
Report X-2024030029

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: BETHLEHEM
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1 .X-2024030029 RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR HAZMAT LEAKER. ARRIVED IN PROPER PPE WITH DECISION TREE IN HAND. AFTER LOOKING AT HAZMAT, RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE FOR PROPER CLEAN UP. WHEN CLEANING WAS DONE, TAKEN TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCEDURE. 2. X-2024030030 RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR HAZMAT LEAKER. ARRIVED IN PROPER PPE WITH DECISION TREE IN HAND. AFTER LOOKING AT HAZMATE, RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE FOR PROPER CLEAN UP. WHEN CLEANING WAS DONE, TAKEN TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCEDURE.

item.title: Report X-2024021916
item.description:
Report X-2024021916

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING PACKAGE HANDLING AN AIR PACKAGE WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. THE PACKAGE HANDLER ALSO NOTICED THE SOUND OF DRY ICE PELLETS MOVING INSIDE THE BOX. RESPONDER INSPECTED AND FOUND APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING FOOD. THE OUTER BOX IS PREPRINTED PERISHABLE AND FRAGILE WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM PA USING UPS ACCOUNT 853E2X, CHOANIES BAKERY, 605 HAZEL ST, LEBANON PA 17042. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK.
